We‚Äôre excited to host the Bengaluru Healthcare Meetup ‚Äî a curated gathering of health-tech founders, healthcare professionals, investors, and ecosystem enablers coming together to drive meaningful change, 

üéä Key Highlights of Event

This event is designed to spark, connections, conversations & collaboration 

üöÄ Startup Pitch Zone

A major highlight of the event is the Startup Pitch Session, where selected startups will get a chance to:

Pitch their solutions live on stage

Present in front of investors, mentors, enablers and healthcare leaders

Get real-time feedback, visibility, and potential funding or support

If you‚Äôre building something in health-tech, medtech, wellness, or digital healthcare ‚Äî this is your moment to shine.

ü§ù Networking & Connections

The event offers focused time for:

Interacting with fellow founders, investors, and professionals

Exploring partnerships, collaborations, and mentorship

Sharing your journey and learning from others in the ecosystem

Bring your business cards, ideas, and energy ‚Äî this is where real connections begin.


üçΩÔ∏è Dinner & Conversations

We wrap up the evening with a relaxed networking dinner. Enjoy good food, great company, and open conversations in an informal setting. This is your chance to build relationships beyond the pitch many successful partnerships begin at the dinner table.

If you're building or backing the future of healthcare, you need to be in this room. Apply to pitch or register to attend limited seats available.

IKP EDEN is hosting an engaging panel discussion and a networking session at the intersection of science, capital, and entrepreneurship.
Guests:
Roopan Aulakh (pi Ventures)
Suraj Nair (Ankur Capital)
Aridni Shah (immunitoAI)
Kshitij Rishi (4baseCare)

Whether you‚Äôre a researcher-turned-founder, an operator ready to start your own venture, or a VC looking to support high-potential startups, this conversation will dive into the realities of launching and scaling in the life sciences.

The expert panel will share practical insights on: 
‚Ä¢ Raising capital in today‚Äôs bio funding climate 
‚Ä¢ Building the right team and scientific vision from day one 
‚Ä¢ Navigating the translational gap between research and product 
‚Ä¢ What investors are really looking for at each stage 
‚Ä¢ Lessons learned from both successful exits and painful pivots

Expect candid stories, actionable takeaways, and an audience of peers equally passionate about transforming science into impact.

Who should attend: Early-stage and aspiring bio founders, venture capitalists, industry executives, and anyone interested in the future of biotech, medtech, and life sciences innovation.

üöÄ AI Day for Startups is back! üöÄ

We are excited to invite you to the Google AI Day for Startups event, happening on July 15, 2025, at NSRCEL, IIM Bangalore. This year‚Äôs event is packed with new insights and hands-on learning designed specifically for early-stage startups looking to integrate Generative AI into their products.

The event is part of a nationwide series hosted by Google and ecosystem partners to empower startups across India.

What‚Äôs new this year?

We‚Äôll be exploring cutting-edge AI technologies like AI Agents, Multimodal AI, and the AI Commercialization process - including insights into ROI and real-world applications.

Here‚Äôs what you can expect:¬†
üîπ AI Insights: Gain knowledge on 2025 GenAI trends, latest model developments, and AI tools like AI Agents, Multimodal AI, and AI commercialization strategies, with contributions from Google, industry leaders, VCs, and founders.
üîπ Hands-on Workshops: Participate in guided codelabs where you‚Äôll build GenAI applications and features using powerful Google tools like Gemini API, Gemma, Vertex AI, and AI Studio.
üîπ Networking: Connect with other startup founders, developers, VCs, and Googlers to explore new opportunities and grow your network.

If you're a startup founder, CXO, or developer eager to level up your AI knowledge and skills, this is an event you won‚Äôt want to miss!

üìÖ Date & Time: 15th July | 9:30 am - 4:30 pm
üìçVenue: NSRCEL, IIM Bangalore

üîó RSVP Now: https://lnkd.in/dUhUwUZQ

Google for Startups Enisha Kalita Farish CV Samhita Rambhatla
#startup #NSRCEL #IIMB #Entrepreneurship #Founders #India #Growth #GenAI #AI #GenerativeAI

A full house, rich dialogue, and global perspectives.

NSRCEL, in collaboration with the AsiaBerlin Summit hosted a cross-border event that brought together innovators from India and Berlin.

We welcomed Franziska Giffey, Senator, Berlin Senate for Economics, during her visit to NSRCEL.¬†She also joined us as a speaker for the panel session on "Female-led Innovation in Emerging and Climate-Forward Sectors"
alongside an inspiring panel of leaders including: Anandi Iyer, Director, Fraunhofer-Gesellschaft Office India, Shelly Mittal, Venture Partner‚ÄìIndia, Chrysalix Venture Capital, Naina Padaki, CEO & Co-Founder, TRUE Assistive Technology, and moderator Kajal Shah, Co-Founder, Dreamfly Innovations .

The event also created a space for networking between Indian and Berlin startups, enabling new connections, shared ideas, and future collaborations.

Looking forward to building more such synergies across borders.

GIIC Berlin Partner f√ºr Wirtschaft und Technologie GmbH European Union

üìä Thank You, Dr. Raghunandan NK! üí°

üôè We at DERBI Foundation extend our sincere appreciation to Dr. Raghunandan N K for conducting a high-impact workshop on the Business Model Canvas (BMC) for our startup cohort.

üï¥ The session offered deep insights into how startups can move beyond traditional business planning to embrace flexible, iterative, and value-driven models. 

ü™û From refining the value proposition and customer segmentation to mapping key metrics, pricing strategies, and leveraging unfair advantages, the workshop equipped our founders with practical tools to build, test, and evolve their models.

Key highlights included:
 ‚úÖ Understanding the BMC framework and its adaptability
 ‚úÖ The Build-Measure-Learn loop in validating startup assumptions
 ‚úÖ Identifying customer pain points and market demand
 ‚úÖ Real-life examples that grounded theory in startup reality

Thank you, Dr. Raghunandan, for empowering our startups with the clarity and structure needed to navigate their growth with confidence and strategy!

Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | MeitY Startup Hub | Pankaj Anand | Startup Karnataka | Karnataka Digital Economy Mission (KDEM) | 

#BusinessModelCanvas #StartupAcceleration #DERBIFoundation #MentorshipMatters #EarlyStageStartups #BuildMeasureLearn #Innovation #Entrepreneurship #StartupSupport #StrategyExecution #ThankYou

Thrilled to see Sound Hub Denmark backing trailblazing #soundtech and #deeptech innovations like Backyard Creators through their latest investment!

As a startup supported by DERBI Foundation, it's inspiring to witness global initiatives like this that are investing in purpose-driven ventures with transformative potential. 

At DERBI Foundation, we‚Äôve experienced firsthand how the right ecosystem support‚Äîaccess to prototyping, mentorship, and patient capital‚Äîcan shape the journey of early-stage innovators.

Opportunities like these validate the importance of cross-border collaboration in building technologies that don't just push the envelope but also address real-world challenges in health, sustainability, and quality of life.

Kudos to Sound Hub Denmark for amplifying the sound of the future‚Äîquite literally! üîä

 #StartupFunding #Deeptech #DERBIFoundation #GlobalInnovation #StartupEcosystem #SoundInnovation

Dr.Premachandra Sagar | Rohan Prem Sagar | Sathyanarayana B V | Bhavani G | Dr. Adithya Hande | Daamini Sharma | HDFC Bank Parivartan | Raman Radhakrishnan | Lakshmanan Radhakrishnan | MeitY Startup Hub | Biotechnology Industry Research Assistance Council (BIRAC) | Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade | Startup India | India DST |

üéì Academia Meets Innovation at DERBI Foundation! üß†üöÄ

We were delighted to welcome faculty members from the Dayananda Sagar Business Academy as part of a Faculty Development Program (FDP) aimed at bridging the gap between academic knowledge and entrepreneurial application.

The session included an engaging walkthrough of DERBI Foundation‚Äôs lab and Dayananda Sagar University's innovation campus at Kudlu Gate, where faculty had the opportunity to experience the startup ecosystem up close, from ideation spaces to prototyping labs, and incubation support facilities.

The visit sparked meaningful conversations around how real-world problem-solving, startup exposure, and innovation-driven thinking can be brought into the classroom to better prepare students for tomorrow‚Äôs challenges.

We look forward to more such academia-industry interactions that nurture a stronger entrepreneurial culture on campuses! üå±üí°

https://www.linkedin.com/company/social-.text:
India‚Äôs livestock sector is growing‚Äîbut so is the waste it generates. 

Inadequate waste management leads to methane emissions, groundwater contamination, and health risks for farm-adjacent and farming communities.¬†
At the same time, this waste stream holds untapped value‚Äîfrom clean energy to soil health to circular inputs for agriculture. 

We‚Äôre inviting start-ups using AI/ML and IoT in developing solutions that: 

- Transform livestock waste into biogas, biofertilisers, or organic inputs¬†
- Build decentralised, efficient processing systems¬†
- Reduce handling complexity and make adoption feasible for small farmers¬†
- Enable climate-positive, income-generating uses of dairy or poultry waste 

Solutions should be scalable, sustainable, and relevant to low-resource rural or peri-urban contexts. 

Selected start-ups will receive funding, lab and prototyping support, incubation, expert mentorship, and access to implementation and capital partners. 

Applications close on 13th July 2025.¬†Apply now: https://lnkd.in/gNwjafu8

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Cisco | Harish Krishnan | Rohini Kamath | Tarun Anthony

#FarmingForward #LivestockWasteInnovation #CircularEconomy #SocialAlpha #CiscoCSR #DeepTechForAgriculture

Work In Progress ‚Äì July 2025 edition is here! 

This month, we spotlight innovation that shows up in many forms‚Äîquiet pilots, policy dialogues, and global collaborations. 

From linking biogas systems to global carbon markets to grassroots workshops on soil resilience, to deep-tech solutions making their mark across Southeast Asia, Europe, and the Middle East‚Äîthis edition captures the steady convergence of ideas, communities, and systems. 

You‚Äôll find start-ups shaping climate-resilient agriculture, ocean sustainability, dignified health access, and decentralised energy. You'll also see how IP milestones, field demos, and cross-sector partnerships are laying the foundation for future scale. 

Explore these stories of layered progress‚Äîand the people making it possible. 

Subscribe to receive future editions: https://lnkd.in/gw6bPWVh
¬† ¬†
Explore past editions: https://lnkd.in/gh4aF9cq¬† 

Sustain Plus | Manoj Kumar | Ganesh Neelam | Smita Rakesh | Dr Kavita Singh | Neeraj Jain | Harish Hande 

#WorkInProgress #InvestedInImpact #InnovationForImpact

Innovators working on developing medical devices for screening and diagnosis often struggle with accessing funds for clinical trials and regulatory pathways. At this stage equity funding is almost non-existent.  (Sometimes it may be there but comes with extremely bad terms combined wifh hyper-dilution and horrific captables). 

This is where blended finance needs to be redefined. Capital providers need to understand that  de-risking early stage startups requires a continuum of capital where non dilutive and dilutive capital pools operate synchronously throughtout the product lifecycle depending upon the stage, complexity and market readiness of the innovations. This is not like a relay race where capital providers change roles but more like an orchestra where different pools can synchronise their risk underwriting and maximise the impact while creating value as the innovations transition from the lab to market.

#blendedfinance #valleyofdeath #impact #innovation  Social Alpha

Venture Center is an award winning, leading incubator for deeptech, knowledge intensive startups, and our ùó•ùó≤ùòÄùó∂ùó±ùó≤ùóªùòÅ ùóúùóªùó∞ùòÇùóØùóÆùòÅùó∂ùóºùóª ùó£ùóøùóºùó¥ùóøùóÆùó∫ for startups offers a range of benefits‚Äîwithout taking any equity!

1. World-Class Infrastructure

Access to state-of-the-art labs, fully equipped offices, and flexible desks. Our facilities are designed to meet the diverse needs of startups, providing everything you need to innovate and grow.

2. Expert Mentorship and Guidance

24/7 access to in-house expertise, in addition to customized one-on-one mentoring from industry veterans. 

3. Funding Opportunities

Access to seed funds, CSR funds, and government grants for different stages of your journey.

4. Prime Location

We are based in Pune, a city known for its thriving tech and innovation scene, and we are in close proximity to prestigious educational institutions and research centers. 

5. Comprehensive Ecosystem

Our extensive support network includes legal assistance, business development resources, regulatory and IP support, and access to workshops and events that provide valuable insights and networking opportunities. 

6. Vibrant peer group community on our campus

Surround yourself with like-minded innovators and entrepreneurs who can inspire and support your startup journey.

We are pleased to welcome KeraX Venture Lab to Venture Center!

KeraX Venture Lab, the venture and technology-scouting arm of KeraLink International, has joined the Venture Center ecosystem under our Soft Landing Program.

By establishing its presence at Venture Center, KeraX Venture Lab aims to identify, de-risk, and scale promising technologies, including AI-driven diagnostics, bioengineered corneal implants, and protective solutions that can transform eye care delivery and accessibility in underserved regions. 

KeraX Venture Lab will work closely with innovators, startups, and partners to build a pipeline of impactful solutions, ensuring that advanced eye care reaches those who need it most. 

We look forward to supporting KeraX Venture Lab as they drive forward innovations that bring the gift of sight to many.

At ProtoQuik Launchpad, startups learn how to engineer for scale. Thus, creating systems that don‚Äôt just work once, but work reliably every time. Because in Deep Tech, precision is not optional; it‚Äôs essential.

Empowering Robotics Founders with Legal Acumen.

The Robotics founders of #ProtoQuik Launchpad Cohort 1 had an insightful session on the legal foundations of startup building, conducted by Ankita Singh (Founder) and Yash Vardhan Singh (Counsel) from Sarvaank Associates.

From IP rights and contract structuring to founder agreements and compliance basics ‚Äî the session demystified complex legal concepts that are crucial for Deep Tech startups transitioning from prototype to market.

üôè A big thank you to Ankita and Yash Vardhan for empowering our founders with the legal knowledge they need to scale with confidence.
